page.title: 08OIL SURVEY IN CHRISTCHURCH
page.content: ON THE 20TH OCTOBER, 1985 SIX GREY LORRIES CAME OUTSIDE OUR GATE TESTING FOR OIL IN STONY LANE, CHRISTCHURCH. THEY SENT SHOCK WAVES DOWN INTO THE GROUND AND WHEN THE WAVES CAME UP AGAIN A MAN TOOK A READING. WHEN THEY SENT THE SHOCK WAVES DOWN THE HOUSE SHOOK. MY DAD SAYS THERE IS OIL UNDER OUR HOUSE. IF THERE WAS WE WOULD HAVE TO MOVE TO ANOTHER HOUSE BECAUSE THE GOVERNMENT NEEDS IT. IF IT WAS OUR OWN PROPERTY WE WOULD STILL HAVE TO MOVE. OIL COMPANIES HAVE FOUND QUITE A LOT OF OIL IN DORSET AND THEY ARE ALREADY EXTRACTING IT. SOME LOCAL PEOPLE ARE WORRIED THAT THIS COULD LEAD TO POLLUTION. THE COUNCIL ARE STILL TRYING TO DECIDE ON THE BEST WAY TO TRANSPORT THE OIL, BY PIPELINE, TRAIN OR BY OIL TANKER.
